commit message: [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration

Update to Carge maven plugin 1.2.0

http://cargo.codehaus.org/Maven2+Plugin+Getting+Started
Tidy up proguard a bit
Reformat pom.xml files - using spaces, not tabs
Tidy pom

Avoid hassle of having to context-scope in the KeyRepository

RoboGuice 2 was complaining about not using Context-scoping, but I think
everything should be fine using the Application as the context.

Add failing test for the repo viewer

The RepositoryViewerActivityTest test was formerly empty.

Add integration tests for Branch list activities

Also refactoring Tag test
Remove use of doomed RoboUnitTestCase base class

Use Application rather than Context in CuriousHostKeyRepository

Application is of course always available, and we don't actually need
the Activity context
This should fix the bug on diff view where the thumb is at max even though the diff view is at 50%

Merge pull request #66 from agryson/b5fa1ee690909e3302f48b1ed89717f81262e73d

Diff Slider bugfix - fixes issue #65

Fix for issue #67 - in-url credentials not working

This actually goes a bit further, and as well as allowing clone urls
like this to work:

https://rtyley:mypassword@github.com/rtyley/enigma.git

It also gets the string prompt stuff working so that it actually prompts
you for your username and password if they're not present in the url.

One thing it doesn't yet do is make the input box behave like a proper
password-entry box if it's a password tho...
Fix for yes/no dialog NPE introduced with de1aeed2
tweak gitignore, ignore .idea project files
intellij code style settings

Fix issue #41 - Illegible Person ident window

Correctly use the dialog theme context - basically fixed with the great
info from this post about theme contexts:

https://plus.google.com/107708120842840792570/posts/VTeRBsAeyTi

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8547720/platform-version-independent-custom-dialog-with-standard-icon-title-and-buttons/8547823#8547823
Fix NPE on rotating while showing a username/password prompt
Merge branch 'correct-theme-person-ident-issue-41'

Default text-entry prompt to password-style behaviour

This affects both username & password entry, but is the best option for
a blanket default behaviour

Distinguishing between username and password is a bit more work, and
there's not much harm making username entry password style as well -
especially as this is often put into the clone url.
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release agit-parent-1.28
